question: Which of the following is a Boolean expression? Select all that apply.

answers.feedback: A boolean expression is an expression that evaluates to a boolean value. True and False itsself are also expression!
The comparison between two numbers via == results in either True or False.
3+4 evaluates to 7, which is a number, not a Boolean value. So it is an expression but not Boolean expression!
3+4 evaluates to 7. 7 == 7 then evaluates to True, which is a Boolean value.

With the double quotes surrounding it, False is interpreted as a string, not a Boolean value. If the quotes had not been included, False alone is in fact a Boolean value and thus a Boolean expression.
